text: Resto français. Bon resto considérant le peu de choix dans l'ouest de l'île. J'ai mangé le carré d'agneau, très tendre mais beaucoup de moutarde Dijon et vu que je ne suis pas un fan j'ai demandé au serveur si, la prochaine fois, il se pourrais de la remplacer par une autre sauce et il m'a dit que oui. Ma femme prit la morue d'Islande, délicieux, et sa cousine, de Toronto, prit le homard qui la ravie. Le prix de leurs vins est trop élevé.

last diners of the night to be seated rich and healthy menu items needed to give whole order at once quiet, romantic, candle-lit dining experience, with minimal interruption by staff yummy, decadent dessert with fired white sambuca!

4 course dinner for only $22 from Sunday to Thursday is the main reason for the rating. Great service and nice house that makes you feel that you are on vacation in a chalet somewhere away from the city.    Food was mediocre. Nothing stood out from what we ordered. I wouldn't pay original price to come back though.
The food and service are outstanding. The ambiance is that of a large old farm house and very cozy. I highly recommend this restaurant for an excellent non-pretentious experience.

Good food. Very classic perhaps too much. Something about scampis feels like 1973, perhaps it's just me... ambiance is basically inexistent, very quiet, good for a quiet dinner. I had the filet it was delicious. Rather high prices but quality is there. Nice patio in the back. It's been open for a while so they must be doing something right. I'll go back, but not in a rush to go back.
Un établissement que je recommande. Le service est toujours bon, les plats y sont variés et délicieux. Un excellent rapport qualité prix.

This was the best dining experience I have had during two trips to Montreal, having eaten out every night. The atmosphere is charming...you feel as though you've been transported to the countryside, to a well-appointed  barn house, overlooking a lake. I had the seafood platter and a salad. The platter contained several different types of shellfish, etc. and had a lovely, light seasoning. The service was both attentive and unobtrusive. The prices seem steep but the value for those dollars is well worth it.

J'ai vraiment apprécié mon expérience à la Maison Verte lorsque j'y suis allée, il y a à peu près deux semaines. Le service était excellent et la nourriture était fantastique.   J'ai pris la bavette de veau et celle-ci était parfaitement cuite et tendre. En ce qui concerne le dessert, j'ai pris le moelleux au chocolat qui était accompagné d'une boule de crème glacée au chocolat et au chili. C'était tellement riche et décadent.   Finalement, l'atmosphère était intime et détendue. Il s'agit d'un endroit idéal pour un tête-à-tête. J'y retournerais avec plaisir!

The food here is pretty good.  I've had a few different meals here and I've really enjoyed them. I had fish, sweet breads, and my most recent was rabbit. All have been delicious!  What I actually love this place is the lemon (or lime) palette cleanser after the appetizer course. If you like french cuisine, I would recommend this restaurant, especially if you live in the West Island. Although it's a little expensive and the wines are over-priced (what else is new), its still a good bet. I would say the wine list is a little on the low end of overpriced wine, and their selection is pretty good.
